ratings.comment: Edith is a great teacher. I highly recommend taking a class with her! Also, be sure to stop in to her office hours or set up appointments often with her because she gives great feedback in those. My Spanish abilities overall vastly improved because of this class and her feedback.

Super nice, funny, and invested in students' learning (more so than grades). She made classes fun, though they weren't really mandatory. Some busywork here and there, but tests were easy and she didn't grade the writing hard at all. Good class and great instructor!

Awesome TA that truly cared about her students and knew the most effective was to teach the course. A lot of time spent on reading, but the readings she chose are much more interesting than the other sections, and then the writing portion of the test easier because you remember the stories more. Overall, a fantastic teacher.
She's a great TA! You can definitely learn a lot from her and her grading is fair. She also makes class unique and interesting, I would definitely take her again!

I had Edith for both Spanish 226 and Spanish 311. In both classes she was amazing. She cares a lot about her students and makes an effort to get to know each one of them. She cares more about actual learning than grades. Her assignments aren't demanding but if you do them and do them well you can learn a lot. I highly recommend her!

Edith was my favorite teacher this semester.  She was very helpful and kind.  She created a friendly class environment where I had a lot of fun and improved my writing skills along the way.  If you have the opportunity to take a class taught by her, do it!

Edith was a generally good instructor.  Spanish 226 is easy enough if you just do the homework and go to class.  She was pretty funny from time to time and didn't really make us do unnecessary busy work or activities.

The key to this class is simply showing up. If you skip too often, you will have no clue what's going on. All the grading is based on your writing, so no need to speak Spanish well at all. Just do the work (maybe an hour a week, if that) and you'll be fine. She's also very funny and nice.

She was a pretty easy grader and it was a good transition for me into college Spanish. Native speaker, but finds it much easier to explain things in English which is not the most helpful when moving on to higher level courses.

Edith was a very good TA. The class was very well organized and the grading was extremely fair. If you show up to class and put some time into reading the materials, the exams should be easy. As a teacher, she was helpful and enthusiastic. Very good class overall!
Maybe this semester was not the best for Edith, but she was not helpful at all, and her grading was far from fair. Be aware of her "bad days".
Great TA and cares more about actual learning than tests and grades. I would definitely recommended her.
Genuinely nice TA.  She grades reasonably and she is understanding and flexible when difficult circumstances come up.

She's a TA for Spanish. She's pretty funny. She always has good stories that have nothing to do with what's going on, but it doesn't matter because she tells them in Spanish so it's really like you're studying anyway.
